script.name: !plugin.autotrade.fuel
script.description: Autotrade - Check fuel for next jump and fuel up if needed

line.comment: * Gnasirator, 16.01.2012
* returns true only if ship may jump on next flight
* Fuel var overview:
* fuel.per.sector = amount of fuel consumed per sector when jumping
* jumps.reserve = amount of jumps to reserve for emergency
* fuel.reserve = jumps.reserve * fuel.per.sector
* jumps.max = maximum traderange to keep fuel for
* jumps.journey = amount of jumps for next journey
* fuel.max = ( jumps.traderange + fuel.reserve ) * fuel.per.sector
* fuel.max hence is the absolute maximum amount of fuel ever to be seen on board
* fuel.max.true is the max regularly usable amount of fuel in tank
* $fuel.max.true = $fuel.max - $fuel.reserve
* fuel.for.journey = amount of fuel that will be consumed by next journey
* fuel.lack.for.journey = fuel I lack for my next journey
* fuel.current = Current total amount of fuel on board
* fuel.current.true = Current amount of fuel without reserve
* fuel.tobuy = amount that really has to be bought
* Init script and non-dynamic fuel vars
* Jumping allowed?
* If no jumpdrive on board -> quit
* restore old comms after refuelling
* stuff
* update dynamic fuel vars
* They can change e.g. when jumped to fuel.station
* already refuel if fuel getting low but only if not buying EC anyway
* Do we have enough fuel for next jump?
* Final check: So do I need fuel?
* Find a suitable fuel station to refuel at
* TODO: try to find station within jump range based on currently available fuel if lower than:
* trade range for UTs
* trade range - jumps to home sector for LTs (also begin from current sector instead of home sector)
* script call has been updated for LU 1.3.5
* Final check: Do we have a fuel station?
* Fly to found fuel station
* not used as it is not really necessary to indicate the refuelling
* [THIS]-> set command: [COMMAND_GET_WARE] target=$Fuel.station target2=$Fuel.station par1=null par2=null
* set script command target: $Fuel.station
* set script command: <Unrecognised Parameter>
* Only jump, if enough fuel (except reserve)
* register cost of jump fuel to spend
* rather get fuel delivered instead of flying long journeys through space
* I'm in fuel.station.sector
* I'm at the fuel station now, update fuel vars and buy needed fuel
* Uses auto resupply of jump energy, no explicit buy commands needed.
* Update vars only, if I moved to another sector to reach fuel station
* now even if in same sector, since autojump can have minimum range = 0
* $fuel.beforebuy = [THIS]-> get true amount of ware {Energy Cells} in cargo bay
* $fuel.price = $Fuel.station-> get price of ware {Energy Cells}
* = [THIS]-> buy $fuel.lack.to.max units of {Energy Cells}
* $fuel.after.buy = [THIS]-> get true amount of ware {Energy Cells} in cargo bay
* $fuel.bought = $fuel.after.buy - $fuel.beforebuy
* $fuel.total = $fuel.bought * $fuel.price
* = [THIS]-> call script '!plugin.autotrade.update.gain' : income=null cost=$fuel.total
* $fuel.total = $fuel.total * (-1)
* if I still need more fuel for my journey than I have (without emerg. EC)
* final check
* check if the planned journey can be flown now. Doesn't matter if tank is full
* Only order fuel if really need some!
* [THIS]-> set command: [COMMAND_FREIGHT_GET] target=$aanull target2=$aanull par1=null par2=null
* [THIS]-> set wanted ware to {Energy Cells}
* v9 (SymTec, 28.07.09): Refuel even if you want to buy energy (if it's too far)
* v10 (Gasirator, Jan 2012): Changed fuelling behavior
* v11 (Gnasirator, 15.01.2012): Included refuelling for sector traders
* v20 (Gnasirator, 16.01.2012): Total rebuild with proper var naming rules
* v21: changed fuelling to check per jump, not per journey
* v30 (Raaaak 2014-09-12): now using auto refuel settings of ship, no explicit buying needed. And respects, gets, and releases station trade locks

sval.val: Autotrade - Check fuel for next jump and fuel up if needed
Target env: sector/station/ship
Gnasirator, 16.01.2012
returns true only if ship may jump on next flight
Fuel var overview:
fuel.per.sector = amount of fuel consumed per sector when jumping
jumps.reserve = amount of jumps to reserve for emergency
fuel.reserve = jumps.reserve * fuel.per.sector
jumps.max = maximum traderange to keep fuel for
jumps.journey = amount of jumps for next journey
fuel.max = ( jumps.traderange + fuel.reserve ) * fuel.per.sector
fuel.max hence is the absolute maximum amount of fuel ever to be seen on board
fuel.max.true is the max regularly usable amount of fuel in tank
$fuel.max.true = $fuel.max - $fuel.reserve
fuel.for.journey = amount of fuel that will be consumed by next journey
fuel.lack.for.journey = fuel I lack for my next journey
fuel.current = Current total amount of fuel on board
fuel.current.true = Current amount of fuel without reserve
fuel.tobuy = amount that really has to be bought
Init script and non-dynamic fuel vars
Jumping allowed?
If no jumpdrive on board -> quit
restore old comms after refuelling
update dynamic fuel vars
They can change e.g. when jumped to fuel.station
already refuel if fuel getting low but only if not buying EC anyway
Do we have enough fuel for next jump?
Final check: So do I need fuel?
Find a suitable fuel station to refuel at
TODO: try to find station within jump range based on currently available fuel if lower than:
trade range for UTs
trade range - jumps to home sector for LTs (also begin from current sector instead of home sector)
script call has been updated for LU 1.3.5
Final check: Do we have a fuel station?
Fly to found fuel station
not used as it is not really necessary to indicate the refuelling
[THIS]-> set command: [COMMAND_GET_WARE] target=$Fuel.station target2=$Fuel.station par1=null par2=null
set script command target: $Fuel.station
set script command: <Unrecognised Parameter>
Only jump, if enough fuel (except reserve)
register cost of jump fuel to spend
rather get fuel delivered instead of flying long journeys through space
I'm in fuel.station.sector
I'm at the fuel station now, update fuel vars and buy needed fuel
Uses auto resupply of jump energy, no explicit buy commands needed.
Update vars only, if I moved to another sector to reach fuel station
now even if in same sector, since autojump can have minimum range = 0
$fuel.beforebuy = [THIS]-> get true amount of ware {Energy Cells} in cargo bay
$fuel.price = $Fuel.station-> get price of ware {Energy Cells}
= [THIS]-> buy $fuel.lack.to.max units of {Energy Cells}
$fuel.after.buy = [THIS]-> get true amount of ware {Energy Cells} in cargo bay
$fuel.bought = $fuel.after.buy - $fuel.beforebuy
$fuel.total = $fuel.bought * $fuel.price
= [THIS]-> call script '!plugin.autotrade.update.gain' : income=null cost=$fuel.total
$fuel.total = $fuel.total * (-1)
if I still need more fuel for my journey than I have (without emerg. EC)
final check
check if the planned journey can be flown now. Doesn't matter if tank is full
Only order fuel if really need some!
[THIS]-> set command: [COMMAND_FREIGHT_GET] target=$aanull target2=$aanull par1=null par2=null
[THIS]-> set wanted ware to {Energy Cells}
v9 (SymTec, 28.07.09): Refuel even if you want to buy energy (if it's too far)
v10 (Gasirator, Jan 2012): Changed fuelling behavior
v11 (Gnasirator, 15.01.2012): Included refuelling for sector traders
v20 (Gnasirator, 16.01.2012): Total rebuild with proper var naming rules
v21: changed fuelling to check per jump, not per journey
v30 (Raaaak 2014-09-12): now using auto refuel settings of ship, no explicit buying needed. And respects, gets, and releases station trade locks
